Putin and Trump to meet in Alaska next week to discuss Ukrainian territorial concessions

Astronaut James Lovell, the man who never walked on the Moon, has died
subhead: The former US Navy pilot and commander of the Apollo 13 mission was the only member of the Apollo program to travel twice to the Moon without ever setting foot on its surface.

title: Agnès Levallois: 'The war in Gaza is political and has no military rationale'
subhead: In an opinion piece for Le Monde, the vice president of the Institute for Research and Studies on the Mediterranean and the Middle East, analyzes statements by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who has announced his intention to take full control of the Gaza Strip.

title: Maryam, Afghan chef: 'Leaving Afghanistan brought a whirlwind of emotions, not knowing who you are anymore'
subhead: 'Refugee Recipes' (5/6). Maryam left Afghanistan at the age of 13, crossing 11 countries to reach France. Along the way, in Turkey, she discovered kumpir – a stuffed baked potato – which has since become her lucky dish.

title: Boko Haram lures young people with no prospects from the Lake Chad area
subhead: 'Lake Chad's Troubled Waters' (4/4). In Chad's Lac province, 96% of the population is illiterate, and young people have resigned themselves to scraping by with intermittent jobs. This is a boon for the jihadist group, which recruits disadvantaged people by promising them a steady income.
byline: By Carol Valade (Lac province (Chad), special correspondent)

Life with a disfigured face: 'You never get used to others' stares, you just live with it'
subhead: Whether due to an accident or illness, a major facial alteration can profoundly disrupt one's sense of identity. People who have been disfigured describe the painful processes of reclaiming their lives.

title: In rural France, young people keep the local tradition of partying alive
subhead: 'Why Do We Party?' (1/6). In eastern Rignieu-le-Désert, the Amicale Des Jeunes youth association upholds the tradition of local balls, a custom that in some places is now seen as a way of preserving local identity.
byline: By Camille Bordenet (Chazey-sur-Ain (eastern France), special correspondent)

title: In France, suicide affects men three times more than women
subhead: With 13.4 deaths per 100,000 inhabitants, the suicide rate appears to have reached a 'floor' after several decades of decline. While the mental health of young people has drawn significant attention, it is older men who continue to be the most affected.
